meanings.definition: The act of making more commitments than one can realistically fulfill.
meanings.sent1: Her overcommitment to volunteering led to exhaustion.
meanings.sent2: His overcommitment to work caused him to miss important family events.
meanings.sent3: The overcommitment to baking cookies for the entire town left her with no time to eat any herself.
meanings.sent4: His overcommitment to helping others weighed him down like a heavy burden.
meanings.sent5: The overcommitment to studying every subject made her brain feel like it was going to explode.

meanings.definition: The state of being excessively committed to various tasks or obligations.
meanings.sent1: Their overcommitment to social activities left them with no time for relaxation.
meanings.sent2: The team's overcommitment to multiple projects resulted in burnout.
meanings.sent3: The overcommitment to attending every party in town turned into a never-ending cycle of exhaustion.
meanings.sent4: Her overcommitment to her job turned her life into a chaotic juggling act.
meanings.sent5: The overcommitment to exercise left him feeling constantly drained and sore.
